page.title: 03 ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content: In the Circle Community Association arts and crafts room every Tuesday afternoon a group of disabled people, many of them stroke victims,get together with the help of the DHSS to make things in their spare time. We saw an old disabled man doing a tapestry, not yet finshed although it has taken 12 months already. A partly paralysed and blinded old lady working on soft toys, made a clothed toy mouse, sent it to the Barbican in London and won a certificate for her hard work and technique. Other things that were being made were:matting,tea cosies,patterned wicker trays and plastic plant holders. People enjoy the classes and take the opportunity to have a chat.
